content:
Posted: January 27, 2015
												I simply wanted to say this is neither 8-bit nor MMO, and a pathetic excuse of a game, but it seems like a lot of people invested significant amount of time to build and play this game, so I must add some thoughts.I guess its selling point is 100% player built world, which explains why everything looks messy, half-baked and crummy. Remember seeing similar phenomenon in MC freebuild servers. Very few builder-type core players may create something that's actually worth looking at, but majority of builders aren't so talented or got better things to do that the landscape ends up being filled with featureless assortment of random ugly structures. The problem is exacerbated by the fact that builders often end up losing interest rather quickly and abandon their pet project to go somewhere else and start anew, leaving behind ugly husks of their former obsessions which only serves as roadblocks to newcomers trying to explore the world. And I mean UGLY. Can't even tore them down and they're littered with spikes which results in instant death for your newly created character. Really hope there were options for these abandoned structures to self-destruct and morph into forest or something.I've no idea how some reviewers say "tutorials were fun as hell", but I dunno, different taste I guess. Starter dungeon is a joke. Rectangular cage with mobs that spawn all over the place and they won't even fight back properly. Having said that, fighting is a joke. Lag is crazy and you only have one weapon to "fight" moving around in 2D plain; go figure. NPC interaction is a joke. No storyline, no dialogue, no interaction worth caring. Had you ever played any other modern MMOs you'll know beyond doubt this "game" calling itself MMO is a joke. Quests are irrelevant, NPC jokes are equally terrible and quite frankly feels like the writers are insulting you for wasting your time playing this game. This game would've been good in the last century, but the year is 2015 and it is clearly out of time.Music is pretty good though.

content:
Posted: December 17, 2013
Early Access Review
								"Platinum" is required to build your own town, and must be bought with real money.  And it takes a lot of it.  This may be a good game to try if there are some major changes made, however i would not waste my time or money on it until then.The best thing, however is the developers sense of humor. However MOST of the game is player built and MOST people do not share the same humor or intelligence. There are a LOT of misspelled words in the player built areas. Sometimes i could not even guess the meaning!  The leveling up is very repetitive, at some point you will discover you cannot do some things in the game without real money (to buy Platinum).  The player driven quests were the most unique feature, however, many of them are broken or too long or boring to be interesting. The most time i spent in game was trying to complete two player driven quests only to have no way to finish them. Homes people build are mostly empty, and you can only explore so many towns with nothing to really do in them. And you are unable to interact with most items. So no world exploring there , either.

content:
Posted: November 8, 2014
Early Access Review
Hmm...The concept is good, but there are some things I don't like. First and foremost, there are way too many microtransactions (AKA in-app purchases). To build something, you need to buy every single block with coins. To gather enough of them, you have two options; either keep playing and get them (which takes forever) or buy them with real money. So, by that aspect, you may feel kinda scammed, like I did.Regarding the gameplay, it is really difficult to build. You'll have a hard time trying to place a block over another. Try it for your own, you'll see. Sometimes, the block hiding system doesn't work, thus making it impossible to play inside a room.But wait, there are positives; as I mentioned beforehand, I liked the concept, even though it's not new. There is also a fully functional anti-grief system, which I admire, as there is no such thing in Minecraft or Terraria (yet).

content:
Posted: December 30, 2013
Early Access Review
								The concept of 8BitMMO is great. A 100% player built world with combat and an infinite world? Sounds great, right?The way it's executed, however, isn't as great.Before I say anything else, I do /NOT/ believe that you need good graphics to make a good game. That being said, this games graphics are one of the major issues with this game. The majority of the tutorial is telling you what you're even looking at, for example how to distinguish an overpass from the floor below. I think this game would be MUCH better if it had depth. the way it is constructed makes it difficult to tell where you are in comparison to anything. When you go under something, it dissapears, but that leads to even more confusion when trying to navigate through someones building. Furthurmore, when attenpting to build, you must puild from north to south unless using slabs. Attempting to do otherwise causes you to place the block on top of the previously placed one. Trying to build roofs or multi-story buildings is a pain, and the game doesn't tell you how to place blocks in the air without building up untill after you've placed 30 blocks. This wouldn't be an issue, except for the fact that you need gold to buy blocks. In order to get gold, you need to kill enemies, which is a good concept, but as with the rest of the game, is poorly done. The combat in this game consists of either jabbing a super-close ranged sword at the enemy, or using a pixel pistol to shoot the foes down. Aiming properly is difficult, and even if you use the swords, combat is extremely bland and difficult. There are so many things wrong with this game, the few things it does right are not enough to counter them. Like I said before, the concept is great, but I do not recommend this game.

No, you ungrateful♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥go ♥♥♥♥ yourself. Just because mommy and daddy gave you the money to kickstart this game doesn't mean you can walk around like you are some big dev company and anything that anybody says against you is wrong. I could rant in detail about all the things I found stupid with this game, but I'll give a summary. In the time I played I already received a repeat quest. I discovered that building things is PAINFULLY difficult. Also, this is NOT LIKE MINECRAFT in terms of building a world. You have to buy the blocks, with either in game money or real life money. Actually you can buy anything with real life money because this game doesn't even hide the fact that they simply want all your money and could care less about the game. The combat system..... or if you can call it that, is "press space at stuff", and is one of the worst combat systems I have ever had to deal with. Overall 0/10This is the worst MMO game I have ever played and I will tell all my friends and everyone I know to avoid this game like the plague.Edit: Of course this game -has- potential. But it's hella neglected and the devs obviously don't care. They got their money and went on vacation. This could be a good game, but as it is now it's an absolute waste of time.

								 I dind´t play too much, but from what I played, 8BitMMO is a trying hard to be nerdy, I mean, hipster dungeon, and I am like "ha, wait, do we still make hipsters jokes?"Gameplay: Clunky, a basic grinding MMO, go kill this, do that, so boring and repetitive, the combat sucks, press SpcBar to attack, but the range of the sword is bad, and it´s pure random, 50% of the times that you strike at point blank range, you miss. Building is a mess, the perspective doens´t help, and the UI is all over the place, and yes, you can build cool stuff.Storyline:  You wake up in the Dev home, for real like, haha, a unfriendly first meeting, but I think the game is just a big parody, and it doens´t have a plot.Bussiness Model: WTF? Seriously? I mean, everything is so pricey, and you gain so little Gold, but no fear, you the wonderful overpowered microtransations, I mean, in Brazil, where I live, R$(Real, Brazil´s money) or BRL, it costs the double of the dollar, so that pricey ultra duper whatever gold pack costs here 400 R$!(200 U$D!)Aesthetic: It sucks. it ins´t 8 bit btw, it´s boring and bland.Overall: Good Concept, Bad Execution. And I understand for example the aesthetic being crap(Cuz is retro and intentional),but it doens´t excuse an poor and obnoxious title like this.

content:
Posted: February 28, 2016
												Several months ago, I wrote a review for this game and said that I have not abandoned my willingness to change this game for future players. Now I have. In the past, I talked about the various changes this game could use because I cared enough to believe this game can be improved. I truly thought there was hope for improvement. This game left me with nothing more than disappointment for my own inadequacy to change it, and the frustration that it has been left unchanged. With no omission of detail, I will describe all the injustices of this game I have endured and eventually, what led to my eventual retirement.I am a well known player, and I have received numerous achievements including the community's recognition for my candidacy as a moderator. As of this review, it has been about a year since the developer displayed any intentions of enlisting new moderators. Over the course of two weeks, I built this game's only non linear open-world quest. To compensate for the lack of NPC's in the game, I created makeshift ones with pumpkins and hid signs on every NPC, amounting to over 3000 words of dialogue. This construction received no recognition and the only part of the quest that received any major attention was a large boat that represented the last part of the quest.I built a tutorial for this game to remake the current one. The current tutorial cannot be considered, in any shape or form, a tutorial. It teaches basic controls, but it omitted the most important and preliminary components of any mandatory tutorial. There were no instructions on how to build, how to obtain gold, or even how to use the shop.  Most players are turned away in utter confusion for the game's mechanics. Despite spending well over 40 dollars of premium currency on construction of a new tutorial, the developer declined before I even showed him what I made. I reconstructed the spawning area for players. The current one is vestigial other than a mild utility of teleport links to two mandatory dungeons; the rest lead to dead cities and abandoned PVP arenas. This too, was declined without a second thought. I reported two major exploits regarding 9bitmmo (the experimental 3D game viewer).One allows unlimited gold farming and the other allows no-clipping through walls at will. The first was fixed within the day I reported it, and the second has yet to be fixed. The developer has no intention of fixing the second exploit stating simply, "people can already no-clip through more nefarious means". To this day, no-clipping through walls in 9bitmmo leaves all areas open to theft and quest exploitation. I created this game's first and only Megabuild, a castle that spanned the size of a 6X expanded town. The premium currency spent in its construction approaches well over 500 dollars. The most publicity it received was a visit by the developer and publicity on Facebook, twitter, and the sidebar for about two weeks. No monetary compensation was rewarded for its construction, and a teleport pad was never added to the spawn area for players to visit this place.I contributed 400 dollars in donations towards the Novemberbit fundraiser event, amounting to 1000 dollars under my name. The only prize for donating this exorbiant amount is a custom item created and implemented under the name of the donator. Ever since the creations of items for the zealous donators of the game, no other items have been added.What made me quit this game eventually is the ignorance of the developer to sympathize with the players of this game that truly want to make it better for others. If there is criticism to be heard, it falls on deaf ears. It has been over a year since a new building block as added to the game and almost mockingly, the developer still hovers over the forums and regulates posts that criticize the declining state of the game. Chris_Ramos is correct in his review when stating the incident where two game moderators were banned. It is also true he wrote the Spanish translation for the entire game and for compensation, the developer gave him ONE DOLLAR. Even the head moderator of the game was not granted a response when he sent an email asking for an explanation behind the lack of updates. The reason he does not improve the game is not because of a lack of time or budget, it is due to his obstinate and outright refusal to do so. What the developer has committed, and is continuing to commit, is no longer within the moral realm of right or wrong. There are players who have donated thousands of dollars to this game and are taken completely for granted, their doubts met with only trivial responses as they ponder the future of the game. It is no longer a morally questionable demeanor, it an ethical crime. Because nothing categorically imperative in his actions can be considered correct; his actions indicate only a betrayal of the players' loyalty and zeal in favor of a personal agenda. In the past I would ask players to play the game before forming a judgment, and to approach it with an open mind. But with the way the game currently is now, it has no future. Not for as long as the players' loyalties are met with an utter betrayal of expectations.

content:
Posted: February 3, 2015
												After playing for a few day, I feel like I can give an honest review.Hours 1-3: Learning the game and how to build. Ran the beginning dungeons to get XP to build more. So far, enjoying the game.Hours 4-14: Running dungeons are pretty stupid. All of them are player made and all look the same. Learned the best way to make a town is to grind gold in a very Destiny "Loot Cave" method. Basically just click a wall thousands and thousands of time to loot gold. Game itself has become boring, but kept playing to unlock more items and finish my town.Hours 15-16: Finished my town {which is the only enjoyment I really got out of this game}. Decided to explore neighboring towns to only find a wasteland of unfinished and random buildings. Its like an entire world of builders just vanished from a plague... of bordom. At this point, I feel like I wasted hours playing this game... Should have played MineCraft...For a game that has been out for a year. This game is VERY lacking. Its supposed to be an MMO, but with a level cap of 5, that doesnt allow much progress besides building a town with very little crafting matierals. If this game had more pieces to build with and better dungeons, this game would be a lot better. DEVS need to go into the world and start deleted abandoned creations, because at this point, its just random crap everywhere and doesnt feel like a player created world...This game has potential and there seems to be a few people who love this game... I, just like so many others, find this game to be very boring and a poor sandbox builder...Would i recommend? Maybe... Some people really love it, but as a whole, this game sucks. If they added more content and the players actually made dungeons worth playing, I would give a higher score. 4/10

content:
Posted: January 9, 2014
												TITLE: Worst MMO I have played Ugh, I know a bunch of people are going to dislike this, but I got bored. That's why i only played 2.5 hours. Ok, now the reasons.  8BitMMO is a fully player built world, that's a bad idea because there will be a bunch of players leaving blocks everywhere that serve no purpose. The game also has a town system, but whats the point if I can't move my house? I worked hard on it, I don't want to abandon it. Plus I spent in-game coins on it, YES I had to spend my gold on those blocks. And it would be annoying to clean it all up. Also, the building system is bad. I have to go into my inventory, select the item, click the box to drop it, and that's it. Why can't I just select the block I currently have, and place it, like in games like Minecraft. Also, the game is shallow, there are only 3 npcs that give you quests. I would like more npc quests to be added, like in other mmos, so I don't have to run around doing horrible player quests, (more on that later). Also, i'm at level 3, I keep completing quests, and i'm not level 4 yet.  I'm still in the first 5 levels, what the heck i should be leveling up faster. Also there's this place that looks fun that I need to be level 4 though. You know why i'm not level 4? Because of the bad player quests. The players make horribly lazy quests, a lot of the time, they don't put me where the quest is, they give me directions that don't seem to work, and I get lost. Also once, I got a quest where I had to collect keys, and the only keys I found belonged to someone else. Thanks whoever made that quest. I even got a quest to visit a gold/xp farm. Does the developer even monitor this game? What doesn't help is that I progress slowly, and I keep getting the quests I don't want over and over again.  I never get anything new. I would actually like basic quests, that don't force me, TO FIND WHERE THEY ARE LOCATED! Sorry, had to release my anger. Anyways, these are basically the only quests I have seen other than tutorial quests, i'm not kidding. The shop is also bad, they have a very small selection. Also, this is the only place to get blocks. Why can't I find them in places, and gather them them for free? And do they expect to me to pay real money to build a town? It should just be an expensive in-game money price. I know they need money, but if they want my money, they need to get more items in the shop people would actually pay for. Even dungeon items cost real money. Isn't that the main selling point of the game!? Its like if you had to buy the building aspect in Minecraft! Some nitpicks about the game, is the block system. If I try to put a block, between 2x2 wall, the block I placed does not go on the ground, it goes in-between the two top blocks. It makes building a hassle and wastes the player's time. Also, there are only 3 enemies I have seen in the regular world. I know the game is a work in progress, but there should have been more enemies. Some major things are that the game is grindy. It takes FOREVER to level up. I haven't gotten to see what that dimension I found is like. Also I don't see a friends list anywhere. Is an MMO supposed to be social? Then where is the friends list!? Overall, the game is right now in a bad state. With problems everywhere, a bad shop, bad player quests, and some other things, this is the WORST MMO EVER! The developer/developers need to get help, or this game will not prevail. This is a game that right now, has a terrible alpha. The only positive is that it's free. Thank goodness I didn't have to pay money for this piece of♥♥♥♥♥♥ I give it a 2/10 HORRIBLE. This is Qwerty, signing out.Also if this was made by one developer, he needs a bigger team.

number of helpful: 83 of 110 people (75%) found this review helpful10 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 24, 2014
Early Access Review
								This whole game's one of the clunkiest I've played in a while, and not even the funny kind. Just straight up frustrating.The construction is unwieldy as all heck. First, you have to buy all materials from the shop (I'll get to the cost later). Then it becomes a fight with the camera angle to even build a decent house with a roof. Let me tell you, a "slightly" top down view is NOT a good angle for anything construction related. There are even cases where the walls completely block certain tiles, not only making it feel like you're building blindfolded, but also forcing you to deconstruct everything just to build whatever it was the walls were blocking.The combat... Oh the combat. Unless you're ranged, it's almost impossible to battle without getting hit. Normally this would be fine, damage is inevitable, but considering how few hitpoints you get, the damage adds up. Ultimately, you'll be finding yourself dying and going back to the beginning of the world. Even as ranged, there's also the case of extreme respawn times, so be prepared to get shell-shocked.Speaking of worlds, quests are pretty much your only option to even hope of getting decent money and EXP. It takes an EXTREME amount of gold to get enough to build anything past a small house. So unless you like running at cheap enemies, you'll have to do quests. Again, this would normally be fine, but after the initial quests, every quest you get is randomized, and I mean RANDOMIZED. It takes no account what level you are or anything. With some quests taking place in worlds locked behind level requirements, this is a major problem. This is countered with the ability to talk to the quest giver for a different quest, but the number of awful quests to cycle through is astounding. From continuous pixel-perfect gauntlets given to beginners, to ultra vague scavenger hunts, it's like there was no effort put into filtering the good, the bad, and the ugly.Finally, the cost. Like I said before, every block in the game costs coins, heck, even entering certain doors cost coins. I'm talking about an extravigant number of coins. With the small, convoluted shop menu, it's almost impossible to find what exactly you want. Pair that with the cost of everything, good luck trying to build something actually worth looking at. They're practically making you pay to get anything good, and even good's a strong word.This game has no soul. It feels like something thrown together and then presented as an enchanting ground breaking indie game. It doesn't even try to hide the amount of cynicism it throws at you. Even what few NPCs are shown are extremely cynical. Jokes are fine, but having sarcastic remarks the only things NPCs say to you in an already soulless husk of a game just spits in your face. I'm sorry.

content:
Posted: December 19, 2013
Early Access Review
								Where to start..When I first entered the game, there was a lot to learn, and even in the tutorial area, it was difficult to understand it all, especially with so many people in one area. I know this is only because there's only two servers.After that, I walked into a random room and instantly began seeing potty mouths and spammers. Most MMOs have these, but it's very annoying.Everything else went fine, the first 2 dungeons were interesting, but then I ran into a problem. I had been getting the same two player quests that were both broken/glitched, and could not be finished, thus I spent 30 minutes trying to get to level 3, farming gold for blocks. It would of been nicer to be able to choose which quest you get.Basicly, if you want to make your place public, you must pay money for it, which is fine, but it's simply something I wouldnt pay money for yet. Maybe give the option to pay a lot of gold for a small town, where only a few people can enter at a time, otherwise the place you build is basicly your private home, which is something I dont usually care to do. Strip this feature away and it becomes a pointless, spam-filled, glitched building system, MMO.The servers are laggy, and full of undesirables. In a couple of months these things might be changed, but as far as I can tell, it's definitely not worthy of being played just yet. They should of kept it under development until a stable game was put out.

content:
Posted: December 10, 2013
Early Access Review
								This game is very simple but it does not fit the MMO genre. Instead, it is more of a make-shift Creative MMO, similar to Lego Universe (with a weak MMO aspect).There is lots of room for improvement in nearly every aspect.1. The GUI is terrible it needs a overhaul, or at least a opacity option (so that it doesnt get in your face)2. The economy is too unbalanced; building blocks are too expensive3. The "wilderness" is just empty. It needs features like hills or terrain.4. I don't like the idea of man-made dungeons. They should be randomly generated in the wilderness.5. The quests rewards are too little and the experience system is too large. (It takes 2-3 quests to level up)Enduring the poor quality in this beta will really help you for the future, if you like MMOs (as it's easy to get everything; took me 5min of grinding to buy the gear I needed, and will really help when it improves.EDIT: Someone needs to fix the signage preview and dialolgue window!

number of helpful: 16 of 20 people (80%) found this review helpful7 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 17, 2016
												TLDRyou have to spam spacebar for literally (and i mean literally i am not just using it for emphasis) 9 hours to get say a publicpad from a shop that you don't even know will have it. Even if your satisfied never using premium blocks it will still take forever to build something cool after spamming the spacebar for longer.Quests need more tools and quest incentives should be premium currency. The inflation can't be fixed at this point (I assume)The long versionOn the off chance that anyone actually reads this or finds this helpful, this is what the game is.First i want to start off by saying i don't know why i play this game anymore. If your thinking "hmmm sandbox mmo might be interesting" it's hardly either of those things, or if your thinking "if the players make the world its probably filled with spammed blocks" and thats absolutely true, but aside from that and the drama between some (lets say) long time players here is whats wrong.The "quest" systemI figured i'd start with the most obvious and most ignored part of the game. See the quest system is where most of the games problems begin. basically theres only 6 levels and your limited by the type of quest you can create because of the tools you have at your disposal. Most quests are Mazes,find the keys in the maze, get through the maze with invisible spikes,parkour with blocks you can't tell the height of(unless your in 9bit 3d mode which costs 30$),all of the above, or my personal favorite no quest at all.Once you get to level 6 theres no incentive because you gain a measly 50 gold and no exp.Farming or zoothe previous issue extends into this.see zoo's or gold farms are places where you can stab downward through a wall by spamming spacebar to gain gold from spawners. Naturally this broke the economy and inflated prices because now gold is too easy to get and now theres no incentive to do quests other than leveling to 6. To be clearer, the shop item never changed price, but there are items that can only be bought with premium currency. so platinum shops were created where people would sell platinum items for gold. Those were the prices that inflated. but the fact that you have to pay for regular blocks in the first place means if you want to build something cool you better have A)a town or a lot of space in the wilderness to do it B) be extremely patient or pay up the wazoo. Possible solutionsquestsWhile it's a long way from fixing or making the game worth playing in any way, my suggestion would be to make it so that rewardblocks give off platinum sure you can't get a reward block twice, but it's premium currency anyway so it would help players be able to get items they want by completing quests and while i realize that this is not a complete solution it's the best i can come up with. That being said players need more tools to create decent quests like npc's that can be interacted with maybe they give you items (That aren't keys) that can be put into a quest item inventory even that would be a start.farming and inflationI would say there is one, but unfortunately there isn't.it all started from a bug that allowed you to stab downward through a wall thats never been fixed.That's all that needed to be done to fix it, yet it's come to the point where certain people would be very reluctant to change their prices if this problem was fixed. they don't need your gold they are selling it to you out of "courtesy."you know a certain someone even got touchy when i asked him why /tele awesome place was worth 1,000,000 gold i get that your paying for a title (because it's apparently the default suggestion for a telepad name) but even then i doubt even the minority of the players who can afford it would buy it.My final thoughtsThis game could have had so much potential but there are things wrong beyond what i have listed (because the other steam reviews cover them) and this game was really only held together by the  now long dead community. There are over 884,000 registered players and only about 20 will be playing at any given time at maximum. I don't want to dislike this game, but it's a shame that i do.Congrats intrepid explorer!if you got through the grammatical errors, my long rant, and the fact that my final thought wasn't final then you deserve a word of advice. If you decide to play this game and you see me in chat acting like a child although im almost technically and adult and spamming spacebar for the gold cycle instead of doing my biology homework or hanging out with my non-existant friends...Say hello.

												8BitMMO is an action MMO with 8bit graphics... Yes, I know.So, you have a character and a sword, you clear dungeons created by other players and buy stuff to make buildings or dungeons, that doesn't sound so bad, right? Keep reading... You buy with gold that you get through either killing mobs, clearing dungeons or buying with real money. The problem here is variation, the game is boring, there are only about 5 kind of enemies, three types of weapons, the dungeons and cities are all done with the same about 8 kind of blocks you buy in the store... Making this the more repetitive, boring and grinding MMO I've ever played, not to mention its level design...★★☆☆☆ | Disliked it

number of helpful: 11 of 12 people (92%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 30, 2016
												This game kind of gets boring after a while. It at first was really fun, I enjoyed getting better gear, messing around with my pocket universe, and exploring the map. It slowly gets... kind of dull after a while though. CombatThe enemies in this game are all the exact same, except they look different and have different stats. They will try to run at you, and hit you after 5 seconds. Needless to say, they are very easy to kill. PVP is pretty engaging at first, but gets old really quickly. You have 4 types of weapons that each work differently, and considering there is only one developer, this isn't that bad. The issue is the weapons themselves. There are three swords, exactly the same except in damage. There is a gun, that shoots little friendliness pellets at people, and it controls alright. The laser is pretty weird, you charge it for a few seconds, and it shoots a straight line. People actually have made good use of this in pvp, but it seems extermely easy to dodge. Lastly is the hammer, doing a massive area damage, but taking a while to charge. Each of these weapons can be specialized to do well in pvp, and people have become really good at pvp in this game. Regardless, it does get dull quickly, however it is worth trying out. CommunityThe community is actually pretty helpful, when I played this game, I actually learned a lot from other people. The only issue is that for an MMO, there is pretty much nobody. 5-10 people are usually online at a time, which is pretty small considering a huge part of the game is Towns. It would be a much, much better game if it were more active. Because of recent events I have heard of (and not participated in, and as such will not talk about), and the game not really being updated, I doubt this will happen easily. The community that is there is fine, though.BuildingIronically, this is probably the worst aspect of the game. Well, second worst. The mechanics are not that bad, it just takes getting used to. The issue is often, unless you are an expert and know what your doing, it won't turn look very good. This wouldn't be that bad if more materials were available, but microtransactions make it worse.MicrotransactionsI get it, I honestly get it. There has to be a way for servers to keep running, so microtransactions are used. Honestly though, when I get a game, I want all the features available (minus DLC, that's different). It's a bit like PVE, and PVE2. Plants vs Zombies costs some money, but it gives all the features immediately. Plants vs Zombies 2, on the other hand, is free. However, there are many micotransactions. I would rather just pay the $5. Not only do items cost money, though this is forgivable considering items aren't necessarilly needed, and they are obtainable through mystery boxes, but towns and pocket universes need money. Towns need money to make, and money to expand. Pocket Universes need money to expand. Even dungeons, a large gimmick of this game, need money to make. The good news is it's easy to get some items via players, and there are shops that sell them. The bad news is they are really expensive.StyleThe style of this game is actually not that bad. It doesn't look really good, but it's alright. The music is really on your taste, however. I personally don't mind it, but I can easily see people turn off the game after 5 minutes from it. It's essentially 8-bit dubstep. Ironically, it is one of the only aspects of the game that doesn't get old after a while.Final Verdict8-bit mmo, dispite it's flaws, is a fun game. It is a nice little game to pop in every now and then, mess around with, and leave. It isn't by any means horrible, but it isn't a masterpiece either. It's pretty fun for the first 10-20 hours, but then gets dull, depending on your taste. That being said, you should try it out, and if it isn't your style, forget about it. Because of the numerous flaws, and it being boring after a short while, I'm going to have to give it a 5/10. See if you like it, but if it doesn't look like your cup of tea, skip it.

number of helpful: 13 of 16 people (81%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 28, 2016
 Why I nominated this game      I nominated this game for standing the test of time. No matter how deserted the game becomes, the people I have met in the game always make me come back for the rare chance that we have some minigames to play. That is why I nominated 8BitMMO despite my review. (Written 11-23-2016 AT 12:18 PM) Disclaimer    Though my hours may seem low compared to other people who have reviewed this game, they aren't. I have played well over 1,000 hours of this game total combined with Steam and the Standalone version. With that said, lets get started! Oi! Also. I am working on making this review better. Mainly because this review right now seems one sided. Till it is updated. Please don't take the review as "completed"  Tl;dr or something    This will sum up the review if you would rather not read a giant thing of words. The only reason I don't recommend this game is because of recent events in-game. The main Dev went insane and banned two mods. Then everyone freaked out and a lot of stuff went down hill from there. Building    Argh, the building in this game is...weird, different, clunky, any word like those can describe the building in 8BitMMO. The angle that you play at contributes a HUGE part in how you build. At the angle you play at you have to build the back of your building first,them the sides, then the front. If not done in this order, your building will not turn out right. To combat this, you would have to buy the "DLC" called 9BitMMO. It is just a 3D viewer for the game that costs  35 dollars!  this is outrageous just for a 3D viewer for the game! Other than those flaws, if you are able to become an expert builder and learn all the tricks, you are then able to build some  insane  stuff! PVP    The PVP in this game is rather bland and boring with only 3 swords,  that are just recolored versions of each other that only do a little more damage  a pistol, a laser rifle, a hammer, and thats it. Being really good at PVP in the game is rather boring, being consider 2nd best my self; you can take it from me. Other than the weapons you can also heal your self in battle with chicken, steak, and a few other items.  Community    Ok, this is where I become split at where I should recommend this game or not. The community in the game is actually pretty ok! There are some friendly faces out there that can really brighten up your day! But then you have the rare trolls that come in and either start insulting people or just being cringe-worthy.  Rules and Moderators    The rules in this game are...ok? You aren't allowed to really swear besides being able to say "Damnit" and you are not able to spam either but that rule is normal. The moderators are also ok as well, from my experiences they are always fair and never take one side of the situation just because someone is their friend. They also never mute/hard-mute people when they don't deserve it  99% of the time.  Huge Pros and Cons  CONS  Dev who almost never listens to the community and starts going on a muting spree if you ask one simple question. Almost no active community at this point To build anything good you need to buy it with Platinum (Currency bought with real money) PROS  Gold is rather easy to get if you are an active player at farms. A lot of the players and mods are willing to help you if you have trouble. Plat items are able to be bought with in game gold, though a lot I might add. Ending Note(s)    In conclusion, 8BitMMO is an "meh" game with it's flaws, but until the Dev can get his **** together, this will stay negative.

content:
Posted: November 16, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game is painful. I started out enjoying it, but then I realized that I wasn't. The community is, mostly, the Roblox people but even worse. Trying to figure out where something is, where you're putting something, where you're going, and why you can't move hurts your eyes. Whenever you walk under something, it immediately goes invisible. When you walk through an actual person's structure, it flashes like strobe lights. Even more so, when you try to build in this abomination of a game, the fixed camera angle and no FOV fish-eye causes you to put things in the wrong place. The dynamics of building are repetitive and time consuming, not to mention that you run out of materials and you have to grind for hours to get more, or perform a microtransaction. Not to mention, anything put somewhere by a different person cannot be changed. Everybody's low-tier items clutter the ground of the wilderness, and as you walk over them the camera jerks up and back down once you've walked off. It hurts your head after a while, and they're EVERYWHERE. The community, again, is terrible. There is one other way to get money for materials. Player-made quests. What this means, is, you go in their headache castle, walk past traps with no possible way to recognize, see coming, or prevent, and get 1 unit from a currency dispenser at the end. The screenshots are the least cluttered thing in the entire game. Anything else looks like a preschooler's noodle art that they covered in glitter, then tried to flush down a toilet. The dragon that you saw when you clicked on the link to the game? If you tried creating that, you'd spend over $100 and 5 hours. If you do play this game, I did warn you. It sounds good, but it was executed worse than Napoleon's invasion of Russia.

content:
Posted: January 3, 2016
												I have put in a lot of hours into this, almost 2,000 hours to be precise (played on 8bitmmo.net). I am a rather popular player and I have seen alot of things come and go in this. I joined around about june in 2014. | What it's all about |8bitmmo is game is an 8bit styled mmo, the game is in third person mode and follows your character around, which is pretty much a square with legs, arms, and a square head. To accompany the retro look it heavily features chiptune while you're playing the game (for all you nostalgia nerds out there!). In 8bitmmo, it is a very social game as the game revolves around a chat. With this chat, players wouldn't be able to communicate with each other. As the title says, you can literally build anything you want, from dragons to space ships, to pixel art and pirate ships, you can really do it all in 8bitmmo. You can even build quests for players, these quests are always built in towns in which give you your own personal area to build in.| Pros |- There is a postive and a thriving community who are all very welcoming.- The game has recently been released as an alpha and may be updated frequently.- You can build anything you want, as long as it's not innapropriate.- It's relatively easy to obatin gold, there is a farming cycle which lasts for 45 minutes and within that time, players can gain 2000 gold.- There is a market for premium items in which some players are willing to commit to keep the economy alive in the game.- You can have alot of fun in this mmo.| Cons |- The developer is not active.- Only a handful of players really stick around for a while, many players come and go.- The vast majority of new players are mainly 3 year olds who spam the chat all day long, it's extremely irritating.- This game calls itself an "mmo" yet there are only around 10 - 20 players online everyday, if you're lucky, this might be extended to 30 players.| Over all view |Personally, this is my favourite game and I do enjoy it. However, the game needs to be frequently updated and as a consiquence, many players aren't satisfied about the games slow development. Although the developer calls the game an alpha, in my eyes it's still a beta. It is still very basic and needs much more time and effort into the game. However, the community are very enthusiastic about new players and they are genuinly awesome people.| Rating |Overall, I'd rate 8bitmmo 8.5/10

												To start this game was developed by one person. Anyone who has ever coded anything will notice that the developer has most likely thrown his entire life and soul into this (which he has). This game has come so far, and has so much more potential. The community is friendly, and very helpful. Mods are on nearly 24/7, you can message the developer directly on IRC for quick replies. If you want an RPG then don't go here. This is a social, sandbox game. Everything you can do you can do without buying anything with real money. The MOST you have to do in the form of extra payment is buy premium items from other players with gold. Every single thing in this game is player built, and most of them are absolutely amazing. This game deserves so much more attention then it has right now.

content:
Posted: October 7, 2014
Early Access Review
								So, after tinkering around with this game for a short while, I've got an idea of this game. The graphics are pretty shoddy and look kinda off when you move, but they work (for the most part, anyway, determining what layer a block is on is tricky and overhangs just vanish when you're under them). The music is honestly quite enjoyable, but nothing fantastic. Gameplay is simple, but effective: both combat and building have little to them but still satisfied me nonetheless. The menus do their job, but aren't special and don't really look pretty. The NPCs have nice designs (and the ones that speak are often humorous) but enemy AI is incredibly simple and similar.I can't really comment on the MMO aspect, as I prefer playing solo. But for an MMO, I enjoyed my time alone, which is generally a good sign. I've heard complaints of being only playable if you shovel money into it, but I honestly didn't feel that way at all. Overall, the game is lacking. However, there are three factors that stop me from not reccomending this:1) The game is in early access. The biggest problems I have with this game (namely, the artwork and the simplicity) can be very easily fixed with future updates.2) There's just a certain...CHARM the game has. With it's designs and it's dialogue and it's style...there's just something about this game that I love, even if it isn't that great on closer examination.3) The game is free. There is really nothing stopping you from at least trying it out and making a decision.TL;DR: The game is simple and somewhat lazy, but charming and free.

It used to be a good game. It used to be one of the best MMOs on PC, or at least had the potential to be... But now it's completely and utterly ruined by the terrible community and anti-art moderators. Initially the lack of content was okay, after all it was Early Access. But this lack of content hasn't been fixed. In other words - there's nothing to do. Sure it's an MMO, but there's NOTHING TO DO. Came back after months of not playing and within minutes completely changed by mind. Thank God it's free. I honestly don't recommend it unless you're incredibly short on money. Even the original 8 bit idea doesn't hold up as isn't a true 8 bit.I had to change my recommendation, as I couldn't have it as positive anymore on good conscious. Sorry; I can't recommend this game anymore.It's somehow gotten worse through development...

content:
Posted: February 9, 2014
Early Access Review
8BiTMMO ReviewI have played 8BitMMO for a while now and I honestly can't recommend it as a free-2-play title. I'm fully aware of the difficulty of producing a game but this game is neither fun or interesting. There are many games out there like this, there is a massive range of issues plaguing the game and the game uses many different features in conjuncture that are just confusing and difficult. The UI is a joke, as well. CONCEPT:Possibly good on paper - an easy to access MMO that nearly anyone can play. 6/10GRAPHICS:Ugly. I understand that the ability to allow everyone to play the game needs modest graphics but this is just ugly and poorly animated. 2/10SOUND:I can't remember, to be honest. No voice acting and I can't even remember if there were sound effects. That fact alone is probably bad - if I can't remember them. 2/10PLAYABILITY:I guess it's playable for the most part but the developer tries his/her hardest to make it not playable with an uninspired UI, a boring economy and crafting system and a story that is quite simply... not existant. 2/10ENTERTAINMENT:The game amused me for roughly... 5 minutes. After that - there was no entertainment to be found... at all.1/10REPLAYABILITY:LowOVERALL SCORE: 2.5/10[/i]

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 29, 2014
Early Access Review
								Disclaimer :  I have played some of the game, and got the basic gist of it, this review may not be accurate for later on in game, but if it's not, then I will be sure to make another one if it's not. Disclaimer over. Now, time to review. This game seemed like it got a lot of hate, I wondered why. I decieded to play it. The controls are...interesting. It takes a while to get used to. The story seems like the typical RPG game, random hero, do quests, kill enemies, grind for gold to get the decent cr@p. (Dont know if somepeople consider cr@p a swear, i don't, but i'm doing that for the people who think it is) The graphics are decent, aside from the character sprite who can't seem to turn his entire body at times. I had this one part when I turned north, my character sprite only turned to the right, and swung his sword through his back (or something like that, dont really know how to describe it). Other than that, the graphics seem fine. The beginning is crazy, and could make some people giggle or laugh. I have not advanced far in the game, but the quests I have done are basically all the same except for a couple factors changed. (ex : kill 21 lawyer cats.   next quest : kill 21 hipsters.     ex : place -object-      next quest : do the same thing with another object) I know they're all to learn how to do the basic stuff, but it's just all the same thing. I can see why most people do not like this game at all. I somewhat like it. It's in it's early stages, there are bound to be flaws. Hopefully, when the full game comes out, I hope the character sprites look better, i hope the quests get better, and I hope it excels with a decent enough fanbase. It has the potential to do a lot, but it hasn't done much yet.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 19, 2014
Early Access Review
								The wilderness is choked and polluted with unfinished buildings and random blocks lying around. One cannot find a proper and public place to build. The world is not infinite, and that being said, theres random bits and pieces of debris lying around from some long-vanished player. Combat is bland, even given the early access there is only a minimal variety of enemies and weapons. It also gives access to powerful weapons very early in the game, and enemy spawns are quite very visible, making even the newbliest noob an easy way to farm for gold and exp. Building is also a pain, as it is confusing and blocks tend to overlap and behave in an odd way. The biggest problem I had was the "roofing" system. Ceilings that are placed overhead vanish and reappear suddenly, leading to a flashing and annoying ceiling over your characters head. TL;DR: 1. Crappy Combat2. Crappy Building System3. Polluted Wastelands that rival those of Fallout4. If you've played Portal, you will get PTSD relapse from potatoes5. Pay to Build6. Go play Minecraft or TerrariaTL;DR, TL;DRPotatoes, 10/10 would buy

content:
Posted: May 15, 2015
												8bitMMO is a Very fun game. At certain times it can be very boring, depending on what players are online. It is a friendly game, except when people scam, spam, or curse. Be forewarned this happens quite frequently. When people buy plat or plat items, they either sell them or use them. Plat item selling is very common, so it is uncommon for people to buy plat. There are also items called mystery boxes, so you can buy plat items only with gold. There is so much you can do on this game! it depends entirely on what you want to do. If you like making pixel art, there are many blocks that provide colors to do so. One player (Sage) made realistic looking people using only blocks he/she could buy in-game. If you like being a popular and admired player, you can give or sell plat items. In total 8bitMMO is one of the best games i have ever encountered.

content:
Posted: June 29, 2014
Early Access Review
								8BitMMO, created by Robby Zinchak aka RobbyZ is a old school styled Free Roam Rpg. 8BitMMO is a game that takes inspiration from many games such as Minecraft, Legend of Zelda, and even Mario. In 8BitMMO you start off waking up in a man's house who is completely aware that he is in a video game by breaking the 4th wall. He sends you off to complete quests in order to just get you out of his house, he references that he has done this multiple times and that strangers waking up in his house has become a common problem for him. This snarky dialogue made me enjoy my first 10 minutes of the game, as it reminded me of dialogue coming from games like Saints Row. I love it when games make fun of the fact that it is a game. Unfortunately after the tutorial this dialogue seemed to cease and enjoyment of my gameplay experience began to decrease more and more. The combat in 8BitMMO is simple enough to play with one hand, with occasionaly reaching for your mouse. Only having the WASD keys for movement and the space bar for attacking made hunting quests and fighting off enemies a bore after the tutorial. There is also another element that makes 8BitMMO a little more entertaining; the ability to build. You are able to build a houses and environments like a top down Minecraft or Terraria. The building can become tedious with blocks stacking not the way you want them to and having a lack of tools to do anything truly spectacular. Although I didnt enjoy this feature, I did see many interesting and cool user created homes and even areas that put the building and combat to good use. The music is probably what I enjoyed most from 8BitMMO, it had beats that went along with the art direction and it had the convenient feature to skip the current song as if i was using Pandora radio. The game does have a leveling system like most other MMO's that encourage you to rank up in order to get certain items or get to certain areas. I have to completely honest and say that I didnt have a great time with 8BitMMO. It is free on Steam and does offer microtransactions, BUT doesnt flash them around begging for money. The game might be fun with a few friends looking to make your own quests and adventures but playing alone is just plain boring.Overall:8BitMMO has a lot of great ideas that just dont work out yet. After sometime and update the game can be great. The music fits in with the world perfectly and the combat is a little bland. In my opinion I would like to see RobbyZ create either more content for this game or make more games with the same amount of snark and wit that the tutorial of this game had. I loved the original dialogue and was set to play a game that knew how to make fun of its self but instead, I got a bland and lifeless world that could and should be improved dramatically. And could be alot of fun if your bored with nothing new to play or if you find a group to play with.(Roleplaying could be fun in this game)Verdict:7.0Worth a try.(hey its free!)

Posted: July 16, 2015
												For the most part, not a great game in terms of gameplay as Combat is cumbersome though it makes up for it in its simplicity. Opening and closing menu's could be refined as they are annoying to navigate when buying and selecting while building. The title is misleading as this game is not "8-Bit" nor is it a MMO.To put it simply, this game consists of grinding slowly, building, completing quests, leveling up, unlocking new blocks, grinding for those blocks, building again, chatting with people who are trying to get lucky over a game on the internet and then going back to grinding for that sweet new Pimp Suit you just unlocked.tl;dr It's REALLY repetitive and boring

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 24, 2015
												When I play a videogame (regardless of genre), I expect it to grab me by the arms and drag me into it's world. I want to be fully engrossed in it's universe, story, and gameplay.Personally, 8BitMMO did none of this for me.Now, I realize I didn't play this game for very long. I plan to play more of it in the coming days, to really give it a fair shot. I also realize that the focus of this game leans more towards user created content then a narrative-heavy experience. I GET that. But what 8BitMMo is supposed to do, it doesn't seem to do particularly well. It just hasn't made a great impression so far.PROS:--Somewhat clever sense of humor--Relatively empty servers--Easy to pick up and play--Does not require an email address to playCons:--World-building, an already slow and unintersting affair (and unfortunately the whole point of the game), is made more difficult via microtransactions.--Gameplay is fundamentally oversimplified, and not very interesting as a result.--Quests lack challenge and variety--Performance issues-notably server lag.It's just hard to reccomend an MMO like this when there are so many better experiences available.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 16, 2015
												Honestly, this game was a disappointment. At first, this game looked amazing, fun, and well put together. But that's just in the trailor. The truth is,  when you actually begin to play the game, you notice a lot that went wrong. First, it's incredibly hard to figure out how to play. The tutorial doesn't tell you much at all about what you're supposed to do, or how to get started. Second, the block layouts are all very 'chunky' and hard to work with. You can barely tell where blocks actually are, what level they're at, or where a wall is.This game has a camera view very similar to old 8 bit games, but the view genuinely sucks. You can't even see the sides of blocks so even with the different layers, this game doesn't even have a 3d feel to it. Other than that, the character art is awful, battles don't make much sense, and I couldn't even figure out just by playing the game if there's an inventory system.In general, I would rate 8bitMMO 3/10. I just couldn't see a good side to the game.

Early Access Review
								Free2play game (with in-game store of course), what more can you really say? It appeals more to kids or pixel indie game enthusiast types. It's fast paced, which is nice, but it's so freaking convoluted that it can give you a headache or be a bit overwhelming. I would give this a neutral vote because it is a free game, but in lieu of having an absence of that choice, I am downing the vote because of the huge headache it has given me. It also makes it a difficult game to play with friends and the building function, albeit cool, is nothing new nor entertaining. The best thing about the game is how huge the player-made world is. That brough some awe, but not enough to keep me in. But it's a free game, what do you have to lose to try?

Early Access Review
								played maybe 5 minutes of it...(17 minutes to be exact)to be honest, it doesn't deserve a review, positive or negative, however I will do a short one for consumers who may be looking at this game......if you are looking at this game though....I'm sorry you stumbled upon this page.First things first:   yes yes, I know, I've only played 5 minutes of the game....but I want to be honest, this is my opinion..and to take 1 or 2 hours to do a full on review for this game would be the end for me in this life and in the next.* The Music:Terrible, noisy, distorts at times and because of that I muted ALL SOUNDS.* The sound effects:Meh. basically, something you can get off freesounds|org and alot of the sounds used in this game are terrible and...the SFX sound as though they've been ripped right out of another game (or again freesound)* The Graphics:what to say about the graphics....disgusting.   I could easily recreate this game in RPGMaker, attach a server to it, and call it 8bitMMO part 2.1 sequel to 8bitMMO 1.0a.There isn't anything at all that stands out in the graphics, to me anyway, I guess others may think different.* The servers:what...the...hell?This game could easily run on a 1.4ghz CPU with no trouble (not that I have a CPU like that) however with the addition of "Servers" attached to a cheaply made game, it runs like poop on a stick (that slowly dribbles down the stick as it "Melts")    Lag, so much lag (I don't usually get lag on other games, for example Guild Wars 2, Wildstar, Archeage etc.), horrid optimization.......and a bandwith eater?what? a bandwith eater? how? -> Poor optimization, no funds going towards their hardware to "Upgrade" their servers to be more beefier.              I know this because once i started "Playing" on a server, google chrome loaded slow as hell, pages weren't loading at their normal speeds etc. as soon as I turned off the game, everything was fine (what do you know....)* will someone like the facebook page???? please...?constant "popups" asking you to "Like" their facebook page, buy "gold", Twitter....basically, social crap spam.*  Golddidn't spend to much time in this area..obviously...but looks like microtransactions to me.* OverallDon't waste your time on this, nor your money, stay clear of this, and please.....BURN YOUR PC IF YOU ARE EVEN ON THIS STORE PAGE...........

content:
Posted: June 22, 2014
Early Access Review
								I came in, expecting a cheap but fun retro-style MMO where you build stuff. Instead I got a cheap and unfun game with poor hit detection, lots of lag and a rather aggressive player base. The gameplay, while simplistic, doesn't always function the way you want it to, concepts of the game aren't explained well in it's tutorials, and there is no way that I could find of telling when I was getting hit, so I ended up dying when it appeared I was doing really well. The graphics are more akin to a late-era Atari 2600 game as opposed to an 8-bit console, which sort of ruins the entire 8-bit feel. I guess some of the music is catchy, though some of it is also not so good, so it's rather hit-and-miss.I did not spend that much time with the game, but the time I did spend was enough to convince me that this game is not for me, and most likely not a game that was well made. I'd say avoid this one, it's just not worth it.

content:
Posted: June 2, 2014
Early Access Review
								A retro-themed construction mmo. Build alone or with friends. After taking a little time to learn the z-axis mechanics, the system is quite easy to understand and flexible. Don't go in expecting it to be combat-driven, or too complex in the PvP department. Building is the primary focus here, and in this regard it excels. The community will usually answer any questions you may have promptly if you get stuck, just make sure you're polite, and the kindness will be reciprocated. A single developer runs this entire game, so updates are slow, however imput from the players is always taken into consideration. If minecraft-esque construction with a retro twist sounds appealing to you, give 8BitMMO a try.

content:
Posted: September 12, 2015
												Thirteen hours in the last few days, and I still can't quite figure out why I like this game. The graphics are, indeed 8-bit, though the colors are more like 16 bit. 32 bit if you play with the flesh tone color change option (/color <0-9>), as some of the variances are too subtle for 16 bit. You can mod your textures very easily. Which, I did do... Since I was sick of blue glass that you couldn't see through and neon green grass that makes your eyes water. All it takes to mod is a zip file creator and a paint program with transparency.... Go check the community, there's a FAQ for that.Some of the stuff you really want is limited to platinum, which is only available through real-world money. Though, there are people that buy plat items and sell them for gold. (Regular quest cash.) These can go in the houses you build or - honestly - just about anywhere in the world. You can even found towns and build them up with friends.Maybe that's what I like about this game.... When I used to play all those 8 and 16 bit RPGs, I used to think to myself that I could make better houses. This is my chance. (And, yes, I am a fanatic for a certain game that starts with an 's' and ends with 'ims.') Also, the game isn't that difficult. I find that making money is a breeze once you buy a gun and just sit just barely in range of a spawner. Levelling to 4 was long, but - if you do the draco and brain quests - not terribly bad. The draco quests can be repeated by clearing your quest log, by the way. I haven't hit 5 yet, but I'm on the way and looking forward to opening up some more blocks to build with. I'm also really looking forward to gathering enough gold to buy a spawner off of someone that has plat, so I can make a shooting range.

content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
Early Access Review
								       THIS GAME IS GREAT    Most reviews are taking about how terrible the graphics are, but its an 8bit game, so the graphics arnt supposed to be stunning. This game has little bit of everthing for  everytype of player. If your the type on gamer who plays to slay, then your enjoy the completely player built dugeons. If you like to set a mark on the virtual world, then constuct an house, buy a town stone, gather citizens, and be the mayor.          What makes this game great is the freedom. In other games, if you spend REAL money on the game, you can squish every other player, and no one really gets along, but in this game regular players and players with money mix, and work together. For example, people who spend money get speical money called plat, where they can buy exclusive building supplies, but people who dont have money to spare on an 8 bit free video game can still get that exclusive gear. this game is completely player built, most people think that means levels and stuff, but people devolped game modes within the game, and an money conversiony thingy ( 1 plat= 1000 g the devolpers didnt diside that, the players did)       One of may favorite parts of the game is the socialness. Once you get playing you become popular withen the game, and people respect you. people give oppinions on eachothers ideas, they share, donate money, and some towns have a government system started, which is pretty cool.      So if your looking for a game that you create games within that game this is the one for you. I recomed this game to all

content:
Posted: March 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game is an interesting one. I don't know of many games like it. It reminds me of Realm of the Mad God. It is half "hack n' slash" and half "sandbox". Its pretty good, but it does get boring if you don't like grinding (like myself), although there isn't much of it, which is good. The building is a bit wonky, so I tend to avoid it and just explore. I know its still in Early Access, so maybe they'll fix it. Haven't seen to much "pay-to-win", although there isn't much to win. I've put about an hour in so far, and killed some Hipsters, Business Cats, and The Escapist.  There are some quests, and those are pretty cool. The sort-of cool thing is that when you finished the quests that came with the game, you get to do some player quests. Some are "get through the dungeon", some are "find the reward in my city", and some are "here's your reward, you're good at doing nothing". I prefer the latter two (I suck at fighting in games). Overall, its an O.K. game for what it is right now. I suggest you try it, and if you don't like it wait a bit and then come back. Its a pretty small file size too, so that helps. If the current game were the finished product, I would give it 7.5/10.

content:
Posted: December 21, 2013
Early Access Review
								I actually turned this game on expecting to love it immensely. The idea is very appealing on paper, but just something about the execution the turned me off completely. I'm not one to nitpick over graphics but this isn't really an 8-bit game. In fact there's an inconsistency when it comes to graphics altogether. Menus are one thing, the world is another, some of the sprites something else, and the inventory is it's own thing. It seems like each of the components were made individually and then thrown together with glue and duct tape. This game seems to lack an overall harmony.On the bright side it's in early access beta so a lot can change in the coming months. For the time being though... meh. I'll wait a bit before turning it on again.I will however give this game a point of kudos for having a quirky personality. The NPCs are pretty witty and hilarious at times.

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 14, 2013
Early Access Review
								8BitMMO is a great, unique game. I like to think of it as Minecraft-meets-Legend of Zelda-meets-8 Bit graphics. You can build a town, dungeon, PvP arena, or anything you like! The world is entirely player built (even creator Sim9 has to follow the rules of establishing a town). Players can also create their own quests. In a way, the game is like a Wiki, it depends almost entirely upon its users. And the game is still in Beta, so it can only go up from here! I'd recommend this game to all players, casual o hardcore alike. There's something for everybody. And hats. Who doesn't love hats?

content:
Posted: April 25, 2014
Early Access Review
								I played this game for a little bit to see if it was worth playing, but I was disappointed. I started out on the main world and went through the tutorial (Which took a bit of time) and then went out to find a place to build. Ill say this, the world is so populated that it is very VERY hard to find a place to build that wasnt covered in debris from previous players. When i switched to the beta world to see if it was less populated, but I found that my gear did not carry over and i had to start the tutoial all over agin. I just stopped there and decided this game wasnt worth it. Even when i was doing missions in the main world, It wasnt really that fun.  I would just save yourself the trouble and if you want a real mmo, download neverwinter. It is also free and is superior in every way (Unless you have a toaster for a computer)

content:
Posted: December 15, 2013
Early Access Review
								8bitMMO is a promising Early Access game. Ive spent a few minutes playing and I am hooked already. The UI is neat and uncluttered, the controls are perfect for this kind of game and the story line is epic. A new server has been added for increased demand. If you quit the game you appear where you left off last session. objectives are easy to read and follow.The game is easy on the system while still looking good. I really recommend this game. content:
Posted: December 13, 2013
Early Access Review
								It is a  fun causual game. but if you are looking for a hard core MMO to play with friends then this is not the game. I found it fun for the first few hours, but i cannot see this being a game where I bulid a Giant castle. The game right know has a small community so I would personall suggest waiting Exactly a month after the release day. So my first Complaint is that it gets hard to see from time to time when going through the sides. Another small gripe for me is the fact all the Characters look the same, I think that it needs a Character custumization complete with races, hair color, faces, and eye color, it would be something to make the game seem less monotonus. There is almost no Custimization in this game, Aside from Building, also for building you will need to be social in this game other wise you will be having a hard time finding a place to build outside in the world. There is almost no combat in this game though, and the combat that is in it is very monotuns.But there are posotives, The user created content is good because it allows creativity annd the building of the masses. Some good thing is are the personal plots of land that you can get which then allow you to have some land that can not be trifled with. I enjoy the silly art style and the fact it never takes itself to serously.So Ultimatley i found this to be an enjoyable pixaleated mix of Minecraft and Terria, The community is fair. So I give this game a good 4 out of ten 10, which is pretty good for an indi Developed game like this, i suggest a buy when it drops below five dollars, it will give you atleast an hour of enjoyment.

content:
Posted: June 14, 2016
												8bitmmo is a fun game for those willing to pay attention, It has a great community and the game gives you a variety of ways to bind you all together so you don't feel so isolated. Other reviews make it seem as if there isn't much to do and it's a rather boring game, I think otherwise. You can build a mansion, Start a town, PvP players with the options of weapons you're gifted by the games weapons menu, and you can join one of our clans!, Clans aren't recognized by the game but are still influential to pvp and building. Clans are a great way to play with friends, and this is just the start of what you can do during 8bitmmo. The building system is pretty complicated at first glance but it becomes fun one you've got the hang of it, I play this game to relax with the amazing friends I've made within this brilliant game.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 31, 2013
Early Access Review
								If you can enjoy some old school graphics, like sandbox games like Minecraft and MMORPG games then there's a good chance you'll find something to enjoy in 8BitMMO.  Unfortunately the game is not without it's issues but keep in mind this is an Early Access Game and in time some of those glaring issues will be ironed out.Lets start with the good however.  First off this game will run on nearly any computer that's still up and running out there.  It's simple grapics style is a solid plus and you can feel confident inviting your friends to join with you no matter what kind of computer they have.  Secondly the game is free-to-play so you really have no excuse as to why you aren't at least trying this game out.  As an added bonus they currently are using what I consider one of the best free to play models out there.  There is nothing in this game, other than some cosmetic hats, that you can't get without spending money.  Other than the time things take to do your experience in this game will be no different whether you spend money or not.So what is the gameplay like??  Well it's in part a roleplaying game.  Combat is currently limited to a small variety of mostly hand held swords that get better as you level and it is very basic but somehow enjoyable.  There are quests you can follow to recieve a nice reward in the end and different monsters to beat up.  Story wise, it's "not-so-serious" gameplay with a lot of witty humor and references to other movies, games, and so forth.  The other part of the game is very sandbox style.  Most of the world can be built up by the players which really gives you a chance to make your mark on the world, including designing dungeons and such for others to adventure in.  You buy the building blocks, monster spawners, and other building materials using in game money, which can be earned by killing monsters and completing quests, or bought with real money.  Other than a handful of hats that is the only thing that real money can buy for you.  Yes your gear is also bought with in game money however it is currently very limited and cheap enough to afford with just monster killing and questing money.  Even building materials are fairly cheap, though it will take some time saving up coins to build anything massive if your not willing to spend real money.So what about the ugly side of the game.  Well first off the servers don't seem to currently be able to handle the load right now.  Granted there were what looked like hundreds of people playing, but I did experience quite a bit of lag that was worse in the more populated areas.  Secondly it is not at all or in any way pretty when it comes to graphics.  In some instances it can be hard to understand where you're supposed to go.  Some of this is players not being used to the building tools and thereby not building their structures in the most presentable way but some of it is simply the limitations of the graphics engine.  As far as audio goes, the sounds are extremely limited.  Start up some tunes of your own before you start the game.Overall this is certainly a game you can and should at least try out.  While there's still a lot of things that can be ironed out there's a huge potential for this game to be massivly fun.  If you can put up with a few hiccups and bumps in the road I belive you'll find this a very enjoyable game.  It's certainly one that I will be playing from time to time and keeping an eye on.

content:
Posted: August 11, 2014
Early Access Review
								So for this being the only thing on steam that my computer can run-- I'd say I have the patience of a shaolin monk. Here's why. The game, although pixelated and simple is quite rich of things. I spent quite a time bored on this game, do to the fact that I didn't have a town or money for that matter.I played it for a few days straight, desperate to hold on to what little patience I had with this computer. Suddenly brought into citizenship, I found a town. The mayor was probably 12 y/o and said "__ okay?" like I was a child that was  pressing the action button to show the next block of text. While in this town I was a "bartender" sitting in an inn while he gained more citizens. After getting bored and going on to another town, I asked this guy --mind you he had the platinum townstone-- if he had a job for me. As my job I made 1k gold a day to donate to town projects. I ended up donating 2k a day out of kindness. I constantly gotten praise for being so nice.A few days later I started to help other people for no reward-- donating 1k to them. I'm bored with the game for now--but I do recommend it to any and everyone. If you spend enough time paying attention, you'll learn to gold farm (There's a gold income system, a 45 minute interval) to get anywhere, and also need weapons to get such gold to get such weapons to get such gold to build amazing things.Confusing?Try walking up to a hipster with your puny noob sword. You will die.This isn't minecraft. Or roblox. Or any childish rpg game.This is 8bitMMO.

content:
Posted: May 11, 2014
Early Access Review
								1st and formost. This game is mainly about building. Too often players come in expecting more. Do not come in expecting freaking world of warcraft. 2nd. The game is run and developed by ONE person who really does work hard to make it better. Yes updates can be small and slow but they do come. 3rd. The game is free to play... Yes there are some things that have to be bought with real money however all items except cloths can be traded for ingame gold. Genrally a LOT of gold but you can still get oretty much everything without having to spend real money. As long as you understand that and can accept that then you just might really like the game.That having been said the games developer has been working on adding more than just building but the game content isn't a lot currently. If you do play just try to build and have fun. Yes the building system can take a bit to get used to and some things can be confusing but most players will try to help you out if not a moderator. OR alternativly watch a few youtube videos.Bottom line. Give it a try and see for yourself weather you like it or not. If you do great and if not it's understandable that not everyone will like it but please don't stay and bash the game if you don't.
