number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 31, 2013
Early Access Review
								If you can enjoy some old school graphics, like sandbox games like Minecraft and MMORPG games then there's a good chance you'll find something to enjoy in 8BitMMO.  Unfortunately the game is not without it's issues but keep in mind this is an Early Access Game and in time some of those glaring issues will be ironed out.Lets start with the good however.  First off this game will run on nearly any computer that's still up and running out there.  It's simple grapics style is a solid plus and you can feel confident inviting your friends to join with you no matter what kind of computer they have.  Secondly the game is free-to-play so you really have no excuse as to why you aren't at least trying this game out.  As an added bonus they currently are using what I consider one of the best free to play models out there.  There is nothing in this game, other than some cosmetic hats, that you can't get without spending money.  Other than the time things take to do your experience in this game will be no different whether you spend money or not.So what is the gameplay like??  Well it's in part a roleplaying game.  Combat is currently limited to a small variety of mostly hand held swords that get better as you level and it is very basic but somehow enjoyable.  There are quests you can follow to recieve a nice reward in the end and different monsters to beat up.  Story wise, it's "not-so-serious" gameplay with a lot of witty humor and references to other movies, games, and so forth.  The other part of the game is very sandbox style.  Most of the world can be built up by the players which really gives you a chance to make your mark on the world, including designing dungeons and such for others to adventure in.  You buy the building blocks, monster spawners, and other building materials using in game money, which can be earned by killing monsters and completing quests, or bought with real money.  Other than a handful of hats that is the only thing that real money can buy for you.  Yes your gear is also bought with in game money however it is currently very limited and cheap enough to afford with just monster killing and questing money.  Even building materials are fairly cheap, though it will take some time saving up coins to build anything massive if your not willing to spend real money.So what about the ugly side of the game.  Well first off the servers don't seem to currently be able to handle the load right now.  Granted there were what looked like hundreds of people playing, but I did experience quite a bit of lag that was worse in the more populated areas.  Secondly it is not at all or in any way pretty when it comes to graphics.  In some instances it can be hard to understand where you're supposed to go.  Some of this is players not being used to the building tools and thereby not building their structures in the most presentable way but some of it is simply the limitations of the graphics engine.  As far as audio goes, the sounds are extremely limited.  Start up some tunes of your own before you start the game.Overall this is certainly a game you can and should at least try out.  While there's still a lot of things that can be ironed out there's a huge potential for this game to be massivly fun.  If you can put up with a few hiccups and bumps in the road I belive you'll find this a very enjoyable game.  It's certainly one that I will be playing from time to time and keeping an eye on.

Early Access Review
								8bitmmo... you apear in the house of some npc named robbyz where after killing some lobbyist slugs.. you are projected into a red room... Hmm.. there are npcs here.... QUESTS! BUILDING! FARMING GOLD AND BEING RICH!!! Then you continue to play this game, because it is beautiful. Seriously. Possibly the best part about this game though, is the fact that there is lots of communication with the developer, and this game is ALWAYS being updated. I doubt you will find a better indie game that has only ONE developer.And to anyone who said the graphics are bad, because they are 8bit. You are really, really, REALLY dumb. This game is supposed to have that retro 8bit look. And you can play the game easily without making any microtransactions. You can get any item (except clothes) from other players without spending much time to get the gold.Chances are, most reviews are from this game in it's older stages. This game has progressed significantly more than most indie games ever do... and it only has one developer...9.8/10

content:
Posted: March 5, 2014
Early Access Review
								There once was a lad who played this game. He wandered around and built a house. Then he discovered that he could become a potato. So, he lept at the opportunity. The lad enjoyed being a potato and hopped around happily. Until one day the lad met a man with an eyepatch and fancy suit. He said to the man "Hi there I have mixed feelings about you. You are wearing an eyepatch. That makes me distrust you, but you are also wearing a fancy suit. Despite that the fact that I cannot figure out why it is so fancy, it makes me trust you.""Well my lad no reason to fear me for I am a mayor. Follow me to my city and I will grant you citizenship and a free plot of land."The lad happily followed the man to his city until they arrived there."Here is my city lad. Go in and make yourself at home.""But sir it is a cave.""Oh my silly boy. It is an underground city. See?" He said as he walked into the cave. The boy saw this as proof enough and went on in."No boy you must pay a small fee to pass this door.""I thought you said it was free of charge.""Oh yes but this a toll for all people. No exceptions."The man waited as the boy deposited the fee. Then the man walked through the door and the boy followed. Except the boy felt the floor move and as he looked he felt himself falling. He did not understand what was going on."Thank you for the gold my dear potato, but I must bid you farewell."The boy fell for about three more seconds until hitting a spike pit and subsequently dying.(Moral of the story never trust a man with an eyepatch no matter how fancy a suit he wears.)

Early Access Review
								8bitmmo is a top down sandbox game with fixed world vision. It has a moderately sized group of core players that keep things steady. There are quests, buildings, artwork, and more. The PVP has been kicked up a notch with the addition of Transponder battles. With many possibilities I suggest you give the game a try.The premium currency items can generally be traded for from other players, so don't be discouraged. Even if you don't want to pay for plat you can still enjoy the game.

content:
Posted: February 19, 2015
												I've had an account in 8BitMMO for nearly three years.And the first thing I have to say about this game is that I personally love it.The community is amazing. It is full of great people willing to help out where necesarry.If you cannot find a town to join, and nobody is responding to you, chances are that most of the players are off and sleeping. Just try again later in the day.Primary is usually a thriving and bustling server with a very good ammount of players for you to meet and socialize with.The moderators do their job to keep an eye on chat, and are also extremely friendly.At first glance, PVP seems bland... But if you try out the weapons and strive to get better, I guarantee you will love it a whole lot more. There are endless possibilities for this game. The only limit is indeed your imagination. Whether you are a creative mind, or just a casual gamer, there is a place in 8BitMMO for you.I highly reccommend downloading the game and trying it out.Hope to see you in the near future!~SapphireCoyote10/10

content:
Posted: July 9, 2016
												8BitMMO, huh? Alright, I guess I can try this.  Plays for an hour  Hm. Addictive.8BitMMO is a clever little game. It's an MMO-sandbox, 8Bit-style. There actually isn't much of a story that I can find, because it doesn't really seem to take that seriously, what with your character being a hobo that broke into the creator's house,  rambling about himself being the hero and having to save the world and all. The creator's response? He's getting bored of these random homeless people entering his house.The more addictive part of this, though, is, as usual:  The building. Don't seem to get it? Happens. Basically,  you have to spend gold at the shop to purchase blocks, weapons, and items for your home . How do you get gold?  Well, you can get it by completing Mr. Zombie's quests, finding reward-blocks in community-made villages, and killing enemies. That's all I have to say about this game. I can't come up with any more intelligable words for it.

content:
Posted: December 10, 2013
Early Access Review
								8BitMMO in my opinion seems to be a game where building a community is key. You don't get handed your materials and get sent out to mine and craft them though like several other games out there. Instead you have two systems working and playing off of each other. On one hand you have the RPG section. Here the system handles your characters progression, shop system, quests, economey and the most importing thing, FIGHTING THE BAD GUYS! On the other hand you have have the Building system that directly feeds off of the RPG system. You fight monsters which nets you gold and expierence which can net you more expierence and gold from a quest but most importantly it lets you get your materials to build. The shop is tiered in such a way that your level dictates what you can buy in the various sections of the shop and you use the gold you gain to purchase the items. You can then take the materials you purchase to your own Pocket Dimension. Here you can build what you want then invite people to visit or open it up to the public. The game has heart behind it. I can clearly see inspirations, aspirations and a future for this game, if it can quickly evolve and try to weather the storm.

								My god and I thought horrible camera angles and views were a thing of the 90's. OH hey your character is behind a wall in a house. Well lets remove that ceiling cause you're inside so your char doesn't need to see that roof. However, that wall yeah lets leave that in your way.Also, What on earth do the devs do in this? Seems like every quest is playermade except for the first 3 maybe? That's great and all but every player quest is either "Oh her move to there get free gold and give donations plox!", "Hey every wall you can't see through may or may not have a trap and by the way watch out for random lasers.", or the worst of them all "Oh hey here is some free gold, donation box is here and there's a free no risk exp/gold farms all over."I mean 3 npcs you start talking to make it seem like oh hey this might be a great game, humor is alright and all. Oh wait that's pretty much all the stuff the devs have done as far as content. Everything else is done by players and their quests are tossed into a RNG pool from 1 npc. So the majority are cash/exp farms and every one out of 50 may actually be a real player quest with story, intrigue and maybe actual normal difficulty that doesn't exploit walls.

content:
Posted: January 17, 2016
												It is definitely easy to play and easy to understand and easy to build and easy in-general. This game can be a lot of fun and it can be pretty creative for a 2D game... But, it hasn't got much content at the moment despite the length of it's release and I hope they improve upon it more in the near future, as the community is pretty small but friendly. Also, some of the achievements are so hard to actually unlock, they are practically bugged and sometimes enemies can attack you through walls. I am going to say yes to recommending this game, simply because of what it is and it's free. But if it ever changes to a more Pay-to-Play, it might go to ruin. In my opinion: it's pretty much Habbo Hotel on Pixelated Crack. Completionist's Note: Now that I have finally done what there is to date, I can finally conclude that my opinion of the games been improved slightly, I had a lot of fun building and the community is really friendly! 75/100.

content:
Posted: February 16, 2014
Early Access Review
								Overall: 9.5/10----------------Gameplay: 6/10Story: -/10Combat: 5/10Concept: 9.5/10-----------------Summary:I do like the fact that you can create your own adventure and play with friends and stuff like that, but the actual gameplay (in it's current stage) is a bit (heh, puns) lacking in certain places. Yes, I know it's an early-access title and that it's still in-development, but I would like to see a bit (heh, another pun) style and diversity in the combat and and customization of your character. Now, in regards to platinum, I don't like the fact that there is no conversion rate between the gold and platinum, and I do not agree that everything should cost platinum after level 3, but, because it's an early-access title this is probably just a temporary donation system and may be worked on as the game is updated more. As for the enemies and combat, I would like to see a bit more variation, maybe a randomly occuring dragon attack or space invasion you have to defend your town against, meanwhile, the combat shows a bit (I swear, I'm on fire today with these puns) of potential, I would like to see a magic/mana system worked into the combat. Other than that, I would say that because this game is free at the moment, you should download it and play it. It shows a lot of potential, and I would really like to see this turn into something great!

content:
Posted: January 31, 2015
												Hmm...The concept is good, but there are some things I don't like. First and foremost, there are way too many microtransactions (AKA in-app purchases). To build something, you need to buy every single block with coins. To gather enough of them, you have two options; either keep playing and get them (which takes forever) or buy them with real money. So, by that aspect, you may feel kinda scammed, like I did.Regarding the gameplay, it is really difficult to build. You'll have a hard time trying to place a block over another. Try it for your own, you'll see. Sometimes, the block hiding system doesn't work, thus making it impossible to play inside a room.But wait, there are positives; as I mentioned beforehand, I liked the concept, even though it's not new. There is also a fully functional anti-grief system, which I admire, as there is no such thing in Minecraft or Terraria (yet).

Early Access Review
								To make things simple, let's put it like this: this game is trying to be something it's not. There's elements of player-built world- except the the whole mess is terrible confusing in 2D.There are complicated society elements like towns and such- except they cost too much for something that is almost useless and challenging in this limited 2D world.There's customization-but everyone still looks almost the same.There's quests to get gold- yet as they're player-created most of them are unplayable.If you wanna play a free-to-play mmo, look elsewhere, because no one should lower down to this.

												A very good, made game. The game is pretty good on the fact that you have freedom on whatever you do, meaning you can make anything you want, in your "pocket universe". The "make your own dungeon" part is really well worked out, and you can find and create one full of trolls and halarious traps that do anything but good. The amount of weapons is broad, considering the amount of time they had with this game. Tell your siblings or friends about this game and ahve you and them steal from each other. Gret game, and hope you will play it!

I say this cos EVERY SINGLE SERVER has a dungeon which you are trapped in IMMEDIATELY on joining. This goes on until your spam bugs the host so much he/she lets you out, then you immediately discover the door is only openable from the other side and you're stuck in one room anyway. Get it if you like hats. There are loads of hats. Loads and loads of hats. I mean SHNITZEL TONS OF HATS! SHNITZEL Tons!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!6/9 - Cos i CAN (swag).P.S. Did I mention? HATS!!!!!!!

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 1, 2015
												It's a good concept, just poorly executed. Though I do love the player created world, I also hate it. Neary everything is claimed, gold income is decent, but the gold/platinum system just kills it for me. If you made it easier to get platinum or everything costed gold, I'd say thats perfect, but back to the world. After taking the random teleport (which by the way only seems to have about a 100x100 tp range) you have to walk for about ten minutes to get to the wilderness where you can build. The world is laggy af in dungeons and the hp scaling on level up is so tiny and leveling up takes so long that you'd be lucky to pass level 3 without any deaths to your name. Vanity items are way too expensive as seen in most games. The buildings in the world are atrocious but that doesn't affect my opinion as those are player made. Honestly, I think it'd be MUCH better if you hade official in game cities with paths between them where you could go off and build from, and make a random warp that puts you not right in someone elses building area. All in all, I'd give this game a 3/10

content:
Posted: November 19, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game is fun. The 100% player built world is no lie. Most of the achivements are hilarious. This is the one game i have in my steam library with over 13 hours.  The only problem i have is the microtransactions. Plat swamps the shop. But at least you can turn into a potato. Most of the building blocks don't cost much, and getting money is easy. You can create enemy spawners and get money from that, along with other things.The trading option is great, along with creating towns with townstones.The 8-bit style is well made. The chosen music for the game fits with the style perfectly. The griefing control in the game is well-made, so people aren't running around taking blocks from your build randomly. I recommend this game greatly. Your'e welcome.

content:

Early Access Review
								Little to do, player quests are terrible, the community isn't helpful, the game isn't really any bit like it wants to be,it's too grindy and the sense of humor is just weird and by no means charming. The game has you kill "hipsters" for some reason. Or "lobbycats" i guess lobbyist cats? And by far the worst part of this game is the perspective. It is so confusing and impossible to navigate. I have had multiple instances where a wall was the exact same texture and placement of the floor, for no reason. It trys to be funny but just falls on it's face and you can't tell where you have to go. The only redeeming quality of this game is the soundtrack, which is phenominal. Otherwise, it's too easy to uninstall.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 12, 2015
Early Access Review
								Spawned in, completed the genericish tutorial, went to my plot of land, tried to burrow into the shell of a community this game has by talking in global chat. There was my first mistake. 90% of feedback was either "&@#! you!" or some people trying to trick people into various things. Then I decided since a global community wasn't what this game had I decided I might actually play. Can I just say here that this game looks fine, if not having a nice feel. Also, hats, thats a +1. But please, please dont make me pay for blocks which I need thousands for to build something that is kinda cool. My wallet said no. Overview: Don't download this game unless you have a network of friends, because global chat hates itself, and also prepare your wallet. "free-to-play" is becoming a less and less relative term. I would like this game if not for the pay-to-have-fun model. Maybe somewhere people would figure out how to make a proper model.

content:
Posted: December 18, 2013
Early Access Review
								Fun for a bit but really has a long way to go. After just a small amount of time playing the game I already find myself just unsure what to do with it, the quests keep looping and all I can do is farm for gold and build something. But the mechanics are there for something really fun and I find myself interested in it constantly. I'd build my own dungeon but I have to shell out far too much real money to get something even going. I recommend it simply because it is free to play and very interesting (it really is a fun idea) but be warned there are microtrasactions to get to the meat of the game and right now there is very little content to play around with.

content:
Posted: May 27, 2015
												This game is a perfect example of a great idea badly displayed. Everything about this game is just so badly done, it's not even funny. Let me start with the perspective. The game's perspective a a mix of 3D and 2D, just so poorly done. It is incredibly hard to build anything you want in this game. The perspective is just unbelieveable, because in a sandbox game, wouldn't you want to build stuff, and you can't even do that is this game. The combat is so boring in the game. I always choose the building quests instead of the combat quests, because their both terrible, just building is better. The game consists of a very toxic and rude community, like Roblox. The game is a huge♥♥♥♥♥failure when it comes to microtransactions because of the unbelieveable deals you can get. The graphics are poor and ugly, like a game that belongs in a flash games website. If you want a sandbox game, i beg you, pick anything, and I mean ANYTHING over this sad excuse of a game.

content:
Posted: December 16, 2013
Early Access Review
1 Part I LikedThe idea of an massively multiplayer online game where you can construct the world sounds pretty cool.1 Part I DislikedThe economics of the game is prohibitive. To build anything you need gold, which is obtained either through poaching monsters from other players, running player created mazes or micro-transactions. These all get boring pretty quickly, and the plain decoration pieces makes it difficult to be proud of what you've built in the first place.

Early Access Review
								Its a funny little game but as the creators say, its NOT done yet. Its sometimes laggy, depending on where you live (only 2 servers in the USA). I have now played it for 30 minutes, and it got boring pretty quick. It has a nice and funny community, but you need to get in the game for a while to actually get into in to a town, get some friends to build things with and that kind of stuff. So, ill try again when its a little bit more "game-like" because, personally, I would not YET get this game out.

Posted: February 7, 2014
Early Access Review
								Its a funny little game but as the creators say, its NOT done yet. Its sometimes laggy, depending on where you live (only 2 servers in the USA). I have now played it for 30 minutes, and it got boring pretty quick. It has a nice and funny community, but you need to get in the game for a while to actually get into in to a town, get some friends to build things with and that kind of stuff. So, ill try again when its a little bit more "game-like" because, personally, I would not YET get this game out.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 31, 2014
Early Access Review
								The first few hours of playing I was excited, because I thought that everything I did in the first 5 mins would be just the tip of the iceberg. Sadly, that is it. All of it. The building is buggy and the fighting is too stiff. Nothing you do feels satisfying. There is that excitement of joining a town, contributing to its growth, but it builds up to nothing. I like the general idea of it - the players make everything and create their own world with cities and quests, but It just lacks depth. It has the potential to be really fun, though. Just needs more creativity.

content:
Posted: September 28, 2014
Early Access Review
								By Now, I have played 8 hours of this game, on a very low-end laptop, there are a lot of things wrong with it, many have established this, but I feel it can become much better in the future, though at it's current state it is very horrible, platinum is needed for a lot of items that you need/want and most of the items cost 10+ platinum (btw 7 platinum = $5!) Literately your only other resort is to hope and pray someone will give you a platinum item for being such a good friend or farming Mobs for a week straight, drink all the coffee in your house, sit up all day and all night so you won't be banned, and sell that 150K+ gold for idk 15+ platinum? (I don't envy the trade system nor do I want to see it) This game has the, let me rephrase that, THIS GAME 'HAD' THE POTENTIAL TO DO GOOD! This was made in 13 YEARS! I mean CMON, I don't even touch SPIKES, I DIE!, I can't scoot OVER FAR ENOUGH ONTO A BLOCK TO GET PAST THE SPIKES, THIS GAME IS A DEATHTRAP OF RAGE! Literately, I Don't even Rage at games, and this one throws me off my record for "Person that Rages the Least Award" I mean cmon bro, Step up your game, add more platinum to the money packages and lastly, put in more optimizations as well as, SELECTIVE QUESTING, I don't like being repettitively asked to do the same quest over and over when I CANT do it because there are SPIKES, LASERS, AND GAME REVIEWERS EVERYWHERE. Sorry, Getting a little out of hand, I do not recommend this game, but if you want to play it, idc, I may continue playing it just because I don't care.

content:
Posted: August 3, 2014
Early Access Review
								Absolutely amazing! I would, and have, recommended this game to others. The community is nice, kind and friendly, and the odd "bad" (inconsiderate?) player is easily dealt with by the multiple game moderators. It's free! Seriously, it's amazing that something this awesome is Free to Play. Some people (I won't lie - me included) don't like the graphics but the Texture Packs made by the community for the community add a really unique feel to the game. Even if a construction looks "bad", most players are considerate and try find as much good points about the build as possible. The developer, Robby Zinchak (Sim9), is really involved with the game and its community, not like some other games (minecraft?). It's a construction sandbox! Personally, I absolutely love construction sandboxes, and one were you can suggest something and it's likely it'll be added? Even better! You can suggest things through either the forums or in the suggestion box and Robby will read it and, possibly, add it in. The moderators are all friendly and I don't have an issue with even 1 of them. You can chat relaxed with the community and it's so laid back it's unbelievable.I would DEFINITELY recommend this game to as many people as I possibly can.

content:
Posted: December 2, 2014
Early Access Review
								This is a decent community oriented game.Basically paying members can get various perks, including home stones to set permissions on a small homestead in the general play area (rather than their private area) town stones that let them set permissions on an area and form a village or city as well as quest stones that let them set up quests for other players.This provides a nice active community where both paying and non-paying members.  It's pretty nice.It's clearly not for everyone.  The graphics are rudimentary but functional, and the gameplay is quite simplistic.  Still, there is a certain community cohesion and simplicity that will appeal to other players.This is clearly a nitch game, but if it's your nitch you will certainly enjoy it.  Your best bet is to try it for free, and see if you like it.   Worst case you lose the few hours you spent learning the game mechanics, and even then observant players who don't like the game will gain insite into the nitch title which may help them understand certain general game and community mechanics that were done right in this game, as well as where the title is lacking which makes it only appeal to a nitch group.Oh yeah, and there's some achievements for you achievement ♥♥♥♥♥s out there. :D

												This is definitely a special game to me, in that it's been built from the ground up by 1 developer who clearly has a lot of his heart and passion poured into this game.Now as a gamer in 8 bit mmo I would simply describe it as a Social and/or Creative game, in that the better your creative and social skills, the more you'll get back from playing this game.Many players trend towards laziness and wont pay attention to the tutorials and faq, or swear and get banned quickly, or try to get into marketing which this game WASNT built for but their overriding greedy tendencies don't care!But ultimately they wont really enjoy this game for what it's really all about, be social! Make friends! Build a community. Or just build beautiful things, build upon ideas or concepts, explore your imagination!Bottom line isIf you have no social grace, nor any imagination. Don't touch this game!I'll continue to support this game as I see a lot of potential for it in the near future!

content:
Posted: December 23, 2014
Early Access Review
								8BitMMO is a game with lots of potential, even though it's in Early Access, it is still pretty fun! I've read lots of reviews going on and on about how bad the building system is, how bad the microtransactions are, and how sucky the community is. I played with these expectations going in, but it wasn't that bad. The building system is actually quite detailed, and getting gold coins isn't that bad, and seriously. A couple bucks torward the developer for the platinum coins (Which you can buy various special things with) is seriously not that bad. As for the community... Eh, it's not all that great but it's definitely not as bad as it's made out to be. There's pretty much no indecent content except for some mild language, but being it an MMO, no-one can account for the online language. This game is really fun, and really underestimated by the community! Instead of reading reviews, try it for yourself! It's free (at least for now), so go make your own opinion!

content:
Posted: January 27, 2014
Early Access Review
								Before this game was on steam, I tried it out for a bit. And I get tell you what this game is. A horrible MMO in which you do nothing but spam your spacebar to kill enemies and read the annoying jokes in large text. This game is pure pay2win and in what no manner has the right to call itself an oldschool 8bit roleplaying game. People will steal your kills in large grinding areas, which makes it almost impossible to level up to get blocks to build your own town without paying money. This game would be like if team fortress two had you pay a small fee out of your steam wallet to capture a control point, the main objective of the entire game. Pass this one on if you're not willing to put tens of hours of grinding into this ridiculous game.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 31, 2013
Early Access Review
								This game is in beta...and it still charges the testers for in-game purchases. I'm so dissapointed. 8-bit games possess some of my favorite titles: Mega Man 5, Legend of Zelda, Double Dragon, and Contra to name a few.  The writing is funny and creative. The combat is extremely basic. (Face enemy and hold spacebar.) The building aspect is what I loved the most. But to be in a town you only have two options. Beg somebody to let you into the town that they paid for, or buy one. I wouldn't really mind the whole asking for access into a town...except nobody seemed to be accepting anyone. I ran around doing quests and I saw the same people standing in place for half an hour just begging every mayor nearby to join. I never saw them move from those spots so I don't know if their pleading ever paid off.. In the end, the game is just not good. There are much better free MMO's to dump your time into than this.Also I cannot stress enough...it CHARGES BETA TESTERS FOR IN-GAME PURCHASES!!!

								This is not a great game, I personally don't think there is one point to play this game. number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 6, 2014
Early Access Review
								Have you read other reviews? Most people have only played for 0.1 to 1 hour, and that's because that's how long they could play it before they wanted to rip thier balls off and choke on them. First, the story. There is none. In the beginning, you're met with a speech bubble containing something along the lines of "You're the hero, save us, blah blah boring story stuff" Now I like humor in games, but this was lust plain lazy. Second, it's not 8-bit, it just has graphics that look like buffallo diarrhea. Third, it's "Free" to play, at least from what I've read, and the quotation marks mean it tells you it's free, but really you need money to do anything. REAL money, not fake money you earn from playing. Now, you do earn virtual money from playing, but you need to do so much grinding, you might as well just use real money. Or better yet, STOP PLAYING! At least, if you did play. Or read other reviews. They are better.

content:
Posted: February 23, 2016
												When I first played this game I was like cool a game that is sandbox. But though it took me awhile to realize after playing the game how bad the community was, how bad the tutorial was and having to buy coins to get 1 block. Lets start with community, This is your community, a little 10 year kid running around saying "HOW DO DIS?" "HOW DO THAT?!" "YOU HAXER♥♥♥♥♥♥♥REPORTED!!". You think thats bad? Well thats only part of it. Next thing, the tutorial barely tells you how to build (very disapointed i was excited for the building part and it gave a horrible tutorial on how to build) doesnt really teach you the basics (the creator was more like i "HEY LETS NOT TELL THESE PEOPLE HOW TO PLAY THE GAME AND PUT ♥♥♥♥♥♥ HUMOR IN IT"). Last but not least the pay2win, I'll be honest it isnt the biggest pay to win game alive but it sure is one. If you want a game that makes you pay like 1000 coins for 1 block, then go ahead knock yourself out its stupid as hell to do something like that. Getting coins is a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥too, you only get like 1 coin to killing 1 enemy which is a waste of time and total bull♥♥♥♥♥♥Overall I highly hope you waste your money on some other game 1/10 rot in hell developer.

content:
Posted: June 18, 2016
												(English)8bitmmo is a fun game for those willing to pay attention, this is a great community and the game gives You numerous ways to bind you all together, to not feel so alone. To do other reviews, it seemed as if there was nothing to do and it's a pretty boring game, I think otherwise. You can build a mansion, the beginning of the city, PvP players with the right weapons you gifted the game menu weapons, and you can join one of our clans!, Clans is not a game, but still powerful in pvp and building. Clans are a great way to play with friends, and this is only the beginning of what you can do 8bitmmo. The building system is quite complex at first glance, but becomes fun. one you got the hang of it, I play this game to relax with friends I made in this brilliant game. 10/10(Русский)8bitmmo-это веселая игра для тех, кто готов обратить внимание, это большое сообщество, и игра дает Вам множество способов, чтобы привязать вас всех вместе, чтобы не чувствовать себя так одиноко. Сделать другие отзывы, казалось, как будто там нечего делать и это довольно скучная игра, я думаю иначе. Вы можете построить особняк, начало города, PvP игроков с нужным оружием ты одаренный меню игры оружия, и вы можете присоединиться к одному из наших кланов!, Кланы не игра, но все еще влиятельных в пвп и дом. Кланы являются отличным способом, чтобы играть с друзьями, и это только начало того, что вы можете сделать 8bitmmo. Системы здания-это довольно сложная на первый взгляд, но становится весело. одним вы получили повесить его, я играю в эту игру, чтобы расслабиться с друзьями я сделал в этой блестящей игре. 10/10

content:
Posted: December 16, 2013
Early Access Review
								There are so many things wrong with this game.  I feel as if the game was made by some middle-school child whom thinks cats are funny, and signs everywhere saying "F*** YOU" is hillarious and appropriate.  The main dungeons are simply just a couple small areas full of players farming spawnpoints, and to make matters worse it seems to have a pay to win type of free gameplay.  Otherwise you won't be able to make anything better looking than the minecrafts dirt house.  Also there are obvious memory leaks.My recommendation is simply to just ignore this things existence; I was hoping for a game which I could build underground dungeons and castles; and everything is just so ugly and awkward to do.

												Sometimes I vomit uncontrollably, spewing half digested supplements upon all that which stand in my immediate vicinity. I often would black out and come to in a puddle of my own blood, mucus, stomache acid, clutching my belly, and tears streaking down my cheeks. These occurrences are quite a kin to playing 8BitMMO.

												Sometimes I vomit uncontrollably, spewing half digested supplements upon all that which stand in my immediate vicinity. Trying desperately to hold in my chunks, my eyes would bulge and the veins would pop, making my vision blurry and red, and as my vision begins to wane I try to let go and let myself vomit, but of course it's too late to stop my eyes from bleeding, and I would get a sharp pain in the side of my head. I often would black out and come to in a puddle of my own blood, mucus, stomache acid, clutching my belly, and tears streaking down my cheeks. These occurrences are quite a kin to playing 8BitMMO.

content:
Posted: October 1, 2015
												This game is such a joke. It's as if it was made by a 12 year old, for a 12 year old with maybe some help from his dad or something. If you don't believe me, the test server is called "potato", a joke that I stopped hearing in 6th grade. The community is a disaster. If you could die from reading stupid messages, I'm sure there would have been atleast a medium sized mass extinction caused by the stupidity of people in this game. Most of them sound like they are between 6-8 yrs old. If you want to build a town in this game, hopefully you got a fat wallet cause this game is just the generic MMO pay2win trash. Platinum is required for a lot of things, and there's no known free way of getting it that I know of.The moderators will mute you for doing something as simple as constructively critisizing the game or saying something that they don't agree with.The game is horribly textured, most of it is something I could easily do myself in MS Paint. The character you play as is just a stick figure with a fat body, stick arms and legs, eyes that appear to be closed all the time, and a solid white colored body.All in all, discovering this game was a traumatic life experience of mine and I don't know if I'll ever be able to recover from how much this game caused my IQ to drop. I'm typing this right now in a mental hospital due to the traumatic memories and such I recieved from it. This game makes me feel like I'm reliving preschool

number of helpful: 3 of 14 people (21%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 12, 2015
												I'd rather post a sideways thumb, but, as there ain't one, I'll give this a thumbs up, due to its creativity.I know my play time in 8bitMMO is pretty low, but thats just it. This game is so simple.  Its pixelated, so feels more like a computer game from 1993-2000. Literally. I felt like I'd fallen into a timewarp or something, when I first tried this.It should be noted that, messages from the community disappear after a few seconds, to minutes(depending on how many are chatting) so it is hard to tell how the community is, or how active it is, to me.Ai is the evil, really terrible....Lawyer Cats. Yea. That appears to be the basic enemy, and may be the only one on the game. Unless the quest sends you to kill a certain thing, such as slugs. And fighting is simple enough. Press the Spacebar. One Lawyer Cat down. Even if you got 4-5 Cats running after you. Oh and as of level 2, my total HP(Hit Points) is the very super high number of 6.You can also build in "towns" across the game. The owner is known as the Mayor, and with his permission, you can build in it, and become a citizen of that town. Then you place blocks down, similarly to MineCraft. Except the game has "flat walls" which is where the game world is flat, and you run along in, what looks like a maze of colored pixels. Just like back in the ancient days of gaming.Overall, this is probably the best MMO for children, or complete newcomers to the genre. Simple, and teaches you the basics of MMO gaming. It also lacks alot of that challenging, wanting to come back for more. Veteran MMO players will probably find this game super boring, while young kids, new MMO comers, or fans of pixelated Indie games may feel like they found a treasure trove with this game. Again, only reason I put a thumbs up was cause, 1. No neutral thumb and 2. Its creativity and uniquness of making it look so pixelated seems 1-of-a-kind.

content:
Posted: March 8, 2014
Early Access Review
								Good game, if you have 2GB RAM then you should be all good. I dont have that much of RAM unfortunately which causes me to lag at some point which bothers me. Why am i recommending it to people? Because, regardless of the requirements its actually a fun game. And even if i lag, i sometimes play just so i can lvl up or something when i'm bored lol. The gameplay looks VERY classic, nice pixels, of course coming from a game that said "8bitmmo" haha, thats how the game works isnt it? Lol! Anyways, its good to have friends to play this, its also a FREE game so go and fight with your friends or invite them in your house in which you make. Theres also PvP, so you can fight players. Anways its a free game so its not like anything matters lol, just give it a try. Its FREE!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 8, 2014
Early Access Review
								So far, I've sunk 2 hours into this game and I love it. The business model, while somewhat constricting, does not require you to spend money, and you can have just as much fun without it. The player quests are a great idea, and if you get one which is broken, you can ask for a new one. The graphics are somewhat confusing, but if you made it through the tutorial you SHOULD get the hang of it fairly easily. The game's sense of humour is great, and so is the rest of it. It's kinda like if Minecraft were a dungeon crawler, with a few extra features on the side.

content:
Posted: March 28, 2014
Early Access Review
								If you like building, Pokemon (The 8bit view field), PvP, puzzles, strategy, or showing off your fancy new hats or cloths, you will love this game. Learning how to build is a task worth learning. Listen to what Draco the Dragon has to say!! He will help a lot. If you ever want to recieve the godly Red Sword, you will have to level up like crazy! Leveling up gets harder and harder, but keep up with the missions, and you will be there in no time. Some of the Player Quests are pretty hard, but read the signs, and reguard the traps and you'll be done in no time! I'd definately recommend this game, it suits all of my gaming wants/needs.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 11, 2014
Early Access Review
								8BitMMo is fun. Nevertheless to say, much like other "F2P" games, it's more of Pay2GetTheRestOfTheGameTemporarily.Why do i say it's that? It's that because the other half of the game, if you want to pay 5$ CONSTANTLY to have all the extra pieces from the store, you need platinum. Platinum is the in-game form of "Screw you all who only have gold, i'm going to lock the rest of the game down till you pay". It's stopping the gameplay. THIS is the problem with F2P. If you say it's F2P, DON'T LOCK THE GAME DOWN UNTIL WE PAY. Fine, Slow gameplay down a bit. Make the pieces harder to get, but don't stop the gameplay.The idiots who do the microtranscations just feed the creator of this gam---- WAIT LEMME REPHRASE THAT! The creator of this Travisty, not game.Onto the actual gameplay. The AI feels cheaply made and easy to farm, Infact, I could make the same in minutes.Actual gameplay? Once again cheaply made. I RARELY fight things in the wilderness. That's caused by things RARELY spawning. Player quests are terrible; I can barely complete one due to hidden reward blocks, etc. It's not the monsters that make them hard. Once again, they're crappily made. Next up, The building tools. Oh god. Multilayered 2D building. That's it, I'm done. No more. I'm uninstalling this crap.So yeah. I give this game 3/10. If it weren't 100% player built, It'd be a .000000000000000001/10.Given, the game is still being made and there's room for MAJOR improvement, But come on, really? Flipping "Flappy Bird" is better than this game. Hold on lemme add another thousand zeros in that decimal. If the developer of this travisty sees my post, Please do fix the things i listed. Actually, lemme correct my rating.I'm gonna be nice here. .1/10EDIT: "Become a zombie"? I HAVE TO PAY REAL MONEY TO DO THAT? WHY DID I WASTE 256 MB OF DISK SPACE? Dear god, the F2P industry is CRAAAAAAAAAP. Double correction, 0.05/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 30, 2013
Early Access Review
								Quite fun, and a time-killer as well. Does need a bit of work:1) When exiting menus such as the inventory when the 'Drop Active' build tool is on, a block is automatically placed on the ground when clicking even if you don't click on the ground.2) The building blocks in the air quest-you can basically place any block anywhere and still pull it off. Also I don't quite understand the z-axis lock...it's not really explained very clearly.I haven't played the game for too long, as you can tell, and I'm aware that it needs improvement, but overall it's a fun little thing. :)EDIT: Also, the shop interface could use some work. It tells me I'm buying things in quantities of ten, and when I open my inventory there is only one of each block that I bought.And when placing blocks, I placed eleven, and then destroyed them all, and only got 7 back...Also the quest where you have to place 100 blocks- you really don't have to build anything at all. You can simply place blocks, remove them, place them again, etc.

Posted: January 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								Well... Let's get started. For it's current state, this game is absolutley terrible. The animation is shotty at best and sometimes your character will randomly speed up for no reason. While moving objects, people and body parts tend to disappear and reappear, making it very hard to not get a seizure. The building... Oh boy... I like the idea that you actually have to kill things for building supplies. By killing monsters, you get gold, which can be used to purchase blocks. But, due to would-be reasonable protection systems for your creations, you can build almost NOWHERE. Heres how it is: You cannot break other player's blocks, or build/break around their blocks. Reasonable, right? No. At the beginning town, Origin, some d-bag must've come through and broken all the grass and replaced it with their own. When trying to place a block (which are awkward because they are 2x1) it says: "You cannot place near other peoples blocks!". This game is currently very, very bad, and I understand its WIP, but whoever made this should've at least had a working movement system that looked decent before releasing this to the public. So let's recap: Horrible animation, d-bag players, odd block dimensions, glitchy npcs, and disappearing things, not to mention a horrible movement system. I think the only thing I can say thats good about this game is its sillyness through chat with npcs, monster names, etc,. But it does not make up for all the absolutley broken mechanics of this game. It isn't even a REMOTELY original idea. Building and fighting in a blocky world! NEVER HEARD THAT ONE BEFORE!
